algorithm_technique: Greedily find prime factors of n from largest to smallest (9 down to 2) to form the smallest number.
problem_summary_simple: Find the smallest positive integer whose digits multiply to a given number n.
problem_summary_technical: Decompose `n` into its prime factors. Greedily use largest possible digits (9 down to 2) to minimize the number of digits and their magnitude.
key_insights: To form the smallest number, we want fewer digits, and for digits at the same position, we want smaller values.
This means we should prioritize using larger digits (9, 8, 7...) as factors first, as they reduce `n` more quickly and contribute fewer digits.
If `n` cannot be fully factored into digits 2-9, no solution exists.
